title: Citibank Korea Donates $400,000 to Support Financial Education
summary: Seoul - Citibank Korea today announced its donation of $400,000 to the 'Think Money - Financial Education through Learning and Experience' program for teenagers.
tag-1: Citibank Korea Donates $400,000 to Support Financial Education
tag-2: Seoul – Citibank Korea today announced its donation of $400,000 to the 'Think Money - Financial Education through Learning and Experience' program for teenagers.
tag-3: Jointly run by Citibank Korea and the National YWCA of Korea since 2006, the program aims to help teenagers learn and understand the importance of finance. Over the last six years, the financial education program has been offered to 270,000 students and gradually expanded to include not only teenagers, but their parents and families through about 30 school partnerships, after-school classes and YWCA centers nationwide. The program offers in-depth and long-term financial education to influence the way people manage their finances, as well as teach the basics of finance.
tag-4: In particular, early this year, two 'Think Money Financial Education' textbooks for elementary and middle school students were approved and published as official textbooks by the Superintendent of Seoul. The textbooks were revised based on the financial education standards announced by the Financial Supervisory Service and feedback received since the program was implemented. The books teach the concepts of finance and decision making, income and expenditure, savings and investments, credit and debt management, risk management and insurance, and also contain supplementary material for activities, such as board games and stickers.
tag-5: Citibank Korea has also published textbooks reflecting the changed financial environment for lower grades of elementary school students. Later this year, a new education book will be published for graduating high school students. In addition, textbooks for teachers and financial education lecturers will be revised and published in March this year.
tag-6: Visit the Think Money website or contact National YWCA of Korea at 02-774-9705 for inquiries about the textbooks or to participate in the program.
